column4: Both VLC and Totem suddenly started playing videos wrong just now. Instead of picture, it just shows a bunch of colored vertical lines. Sound comes out fine.
Both VLC and Totem suddenly started playing videos wrong just now. Instead of picture, it just shows a bunch of colored vertical lines. Sound comes out fine. How do I fix that?
they both probably use 'xv' to draw to the screen
It happened just now, though. I played one movie and it was fine, then it broke on the next one.
So I rebooted to see if that would fix it, and no dice,.
nothing. I was just watching movies and browsing the 'net.
try powering the system fully off for like 10 seconds and starting it up. maybe the video card is in a bad state
I've tried multiple videos, including ones I've had around for months and watched before,.
If I run Totem as root, it still has the same problem.
only thing i can think of is to mess with X settings
Like I said, it's only videos that it's having trouble with. It can play music visualizations in the same space. Is that something that might have to do with X?
It doesn't sound like an xorg problem, if the caps lock is flashing (indicative of kernel panic)
but it gets as far as starting x before it happens...
